dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so Article 676 of the Kazakhstan Tax Code—non-residents can apply for a certificate confirming income and taxes withheld, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so Article six hundred seventy six of the Kazakhstan Tax Code-non-residents can apply for a certificate confirming income and taxes withheld, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Article 676 of the Tax Code Certificate of Income received from Kazakhstan Sources and Taxes withheld (paid) states that: 1. A non-resident may apply for a certificate from the tax authorities confirming income received from Kazakhstan sources and taxes withheld (paid) (the Certificate) in a format approved by the authorised body, if the given tax is due in Kazakhstan, including based on an international treaty, and if it is not refundable in accordance with articles 672, 673 and 674 of the Tax Code.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but only if the tax is due in Kazakhstan and not refundable under articles 672 to 674. It's pretty specific.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but only if the tax is due in Kazakhstan and not refundable under articles six hundred seventy two to six hundred seventy four. It's pretty specific.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A non-resident may apply for a certificate from the tax authorities confirming income received from Kazakhstan sources and taxes withheld (paid) (the Certificate) in a format approved by the authorised body, if the given tax is due in Kazakhstan, including based on an international treaty, and if it is not refundable in accordance with articles 672, 673 and 674 of the Tax Code.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And tax agents can apply on behalf of non-residents too, no power of attorney needed. That's convenient, I guess it's aimed at smoothing things for foreign entities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And tax agents can apply on behalf of non-residents too, no power of attorney needed. That's convenient, I guess it's aimed at smoothing things for foreign entities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tax agents may also apply for Certificates for income accrued and/or paid to non-residents and taxes withheld (paid) on that income. In this case, a power of attorney in accordance with article 16 of the Tax Code is not required.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But wait, what about foreign nationals who are actually tax residents? The article seems to imply this service is only for non-residents.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But wait, what about foreign nationals who are actually tax residents? The article seems to imply this service is only for non-residents.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: From the above it seems that this service is only available to non-residents. So, what about foreign nationals who are residents and not eligible for the service?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! If someone's a resident—like, living there 183 days or more—they should be paying personal tax in Kazakhstan. But then they might not qualify for this certificate? That feels like an oversight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! If someone's a resident-like, living there one hundred eighty three days or more-they should be paying personal tax in Kazakhstan. But then they might not qualify for this certificate? That feels like an oversight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Article 217 of the Tax Code identifies that residents are those individuals permanently residing in Kazakhstan (for at least 183 calendar days in any consecutive 12-month period ending in the current tax period). If someone is recognised as a tax resident in Kazakhstan, then any personal tax should be paid in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And residency isn't always straightforward. Some countries, like France, stop considering you a resident if you work abroad. Plus, Kazakhstan only has double tax treaties with 53 countries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And residency isn't always straightforward. Some countries, like France, stop considering you a resident if you work abroad. Plus, Kazakhstan only has double tax treaties with fifty three countries.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Quite often, countries, such as France, stop recognising their nationals as tax residents if they leave to work abroad. On top of that, Kazakhstan only has double tax treaties with 53 countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So for residents from non-treaty countries, it gets messy. They used to get reconciliation acts before 2017, but now it's personal account statements, and some SRD offices won't even give hard copies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So for residents from non-treaty countries, it gets messy. They used to get reconciliation acts before twenty seventeen, but now it's personal account statements, and some S R D offices won't even give hard copies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This service was abolished in 2017 and has been replaced by personal account statements of budget settlements and social payments, which are issued and stamped by local tax authorities, if applied for. As the service is not that common, a number of SRD refuse to issue statements in hard copy and prefer to download them using electronic keys.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and if they download them electronically, they're not certified. That's a problem for proof. I've heard even tax authorities handle residency inconsistently—some focus on the general concept, others demand certificates.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and if they download them electronically, they're not certified. That's a problem for proof. I've heard even tax authorities handle residency inconsistently-some focus on the general concept, others demand certificates.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If this is the case, they will not be certified by the tax authorities. In a specific case, a deputy from a regional SRD explained that in this context, they do not focus on tax residency, rather the general concept of residency as a whole, while in another regional SRD they require the certificates as described above.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Madina Abisheva from the Tax and Legal Department points out that offices differ in their approach. Form 240 returns sometimes automatically mark all foreigners as non-residents, which just adds to the confusion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Madina Abisheva from the Tax and Legal Department points out that offices differ in their approach. Form two hundred forty returns sometimes automatically mark all foreigners as non-residents, which just adds to the confusion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When tax authority employees hand out returns manually, all foreign nationals are treated automatically as non-residents. From this, we can ascertain that the issue is not yet fully regulated within the tax authorities and approaches tend to differ depending on the office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So the system's not fully regulated yet. Businesses and individuals really have to navigate this patchwork of practices. Not ideal for Kazakhstan aiming to be a top-30 developed economy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So the system's not fully regulated yet. Businesses and individuals really have to navigate this patchwork of practices. Not ideal for Kazakhstan aiming to be a topminus thirty developed economy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan aims to be among the 30 most developed countries in the world. From this, we can ascertain that the issue is not yet fully regulated within the tax authorities and approaches tend to differ depending on the office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely not. Clarity and consistency would go a long way here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely not. Clarity and consistency would go a long way here.
